modules.description: Provides functions to create and manage a pulseaudio connection, read and write audio data using arrays or bigarrays, and control playback flow with drain, flush, and latency queries. Operates on audio samples represented as float arrays or bigarrays, and manages connection parameters like server, client name, and stream settings. Used to interface with pulseaudio for real-time audio processing and playback.

Provides functions to interact with PulseAudio for managing audio streams, setting volume levels, and querying device information. Works with audio context, stream, and device data structures. Used to control audio output in applications requiring real-time volume adjustments or device selection.

Manages audio streams through a pulseaudio connection, supporting playback, recording, and sample uploads with precise buffer control. Operates on float arrays or bigarrays, enabling operations like draining, flushing, and querying latency. Allows setting buffer lengths, pre-buffering for playback, and fragment sizes for recording. Supports real-time audio processing by adjusting stream parameters and handling data flow efficiently.
